PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: William McElroy, 7317 Hamilton Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 18, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that refuse drivers and collectors should be tipped at Christmas time? Is service affected if they are not?" answer reads: "If a person is able to give something, I don't see any harm in their not being tipped, because taxi drivers and other public service workers are tipped.  I don't think that service is affected if they are not tipped."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William McElroy wearing postal uniform and hat with badge, posed in front of light colored car and brick building with billboard that reads "Clear Heads Agree: Calvert... Tastes Better"
